Job Title: Quant Developer - C14 - New York R

Job Description:
About the Role:

Shutterstock is seeking a Marketing Analyst whose primary responsibility will be to support the marketing organization and our pursuit of analytical perfection. This person will bring a mix of innovative ideas, measurement strategy, and tactical execution to support the measurement of our key marketing activities, as well as using their keen eye for identifying opportunities for new value creating programs from the data.

In this role you will:
Analyze the impact and efficiency of acquisition and retargeting campaigns across digital and non-digital marketing channels
Analyze the impact and efficacy of our customer marketing programs across a variety of different channels
Analyze the impact and efficiency Monitor sitewide metrics, such as bounce rate, discovery, on-site click-through, add-to-cart and conversion rate efficiency.
Work with analytics to develop and then analyze dashboards to monitor prospect and customer behaviors
Analyze the user journey, marketing media mix, growth opportunities and more
About You:

You are a problem solver and love puzzles. You have experience with testing design, implementation, and analysis. You always follow the numbers. You are data-driven and a creative thinker with a knack for guiding users towards action. You can look at a problem, a design, and/or a campaign and see room for improvement others don't see. You can also work with a blank slate and create something from nothing. You are comfortable in a fast-paced environment and don't let obstacles prevent you from moving forward. You also know when to double down on a winner and cut your losses early when necessary.

Requirements:
Post-secondary education in a quantitative discipline such as Economics, Statistics, the social sciences, or equivalent experience
2 - 3 years professional business experience
Have an analytical mind, obsess over the details and enjoy solving problems
An Excel guru, master of pivot tables, lookup, formulas
Extremely proficient in SQL and can write queries with ease
Experience with both data manipulation and visualization tools such as Tableau, Snowflake, Microstrategy, Qlikview
Understanding of how to make recommendations and execute them
Experience working with web analytics tools such as GA360
Like to deliver results and make an impact on an organization
Ability to work independently as a self-starter
Ability to work in a fast-paced and demanding environment with minimal supervision
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills
We are one team collectively focused on creating an unrivaled experience for our Customers and Contributors. Our principles represent the mindset of the employee who will thrive at Shutterstock. If you are passionate about what you do, and want to become part of a cutting-edge technology company building industry leading products, please apply.

About Shutterstock, Inc.

Shutterstock, Inc. (NYSE: SSTK), directly and through its group subsidiaries, is a leading global provider of high-quality licensed photographs, vectors, illustrations, videos and music to businesses, marketing agencies and media organizations around the world. Working with its growing community of over 1 million contributors, Shutterstock adds hundreds of thousands of images each week, and currently has more than 330 million images and more than 18 million video clips available.

Headquartered in New York City, Shutterstock has offices around the world and customers in more than 150 countries. The company's brands also include Bigstock, a value-oriented stock media offering; Shutterstock Custom, a custom content creation platform; Offset, a high-end image collection; PremiumBeat, a curated royalty-free music library; and Shutterstock Editorial, a premier source of editorial images for the world's media.

For more information, please visit www.shutterstock.com and follow Shutterstock on Twitter and on Facebook.

Equal Opportunity Employer, M/F/D/V

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

The massive scale and heavy engagement of the people using our products make the Facebook family of products (Instagram, Messenger, Oculus, Whatsapp, among others) an ideal place for advertisers to build their brands and drive results. Our advertising auction is the system marketers use to do that - an automatic system that optimizes which ads to display to users and determines how much advertisers should pay for them. This system produces billions of predictions and processes billions of transactions per day, generating an enormous amount of data. The successful candidate will use this trove of data to enhance our delivery systems, ultimately improving outcomes for our advertisers and adding value for Facebook users in the form of personalized ads. The team is both theoretical and practical, as we generate hypotheses and drive them to production by collaborating with engineers on A/B tests and prototypes.The Auction & Delivery team sits within the broader Marketing Science Research and Development organization. The team is made up of data scientists with a diverse set of backgrounds. Specifically, we have team members with various levels of academic attainment (bachelor's, master's and PhD), work experience and professional background. The ideal candidate for this data science focused position should have a proven track record of analyzing and deriving insights from data. As this team is fundamentally focused on R&D, the candidate must be comfortable with ambiguity and answering broad research questions. They would be intellectually curious, a great communicator, data-driven, a fast learner and able to move fast while keeping focused on high impact projects. Applicants should have a strong quantitative understanding, and a talent for taking complex concepts and distilling them into clear accessible learnings.

Apply analytical skills to complex quantitative problems, presenting actionable insights to key stakeholders
Develop a deep understanding of the auction, analyze current performance and identify opportunities to improve the system
Understand user and advertiser behavior and incentives, allowing us to identify levers to improve advertiser and user outcomes
Research applied machine learning questions in our ads system to improve prediction accuracy and drive advertiser value
Work closely with engineering and product teams to develop hypotheses, run experiments and prototype new product ideas
Work alongside product partners (e.g. Product Managers, Product Marketing Managers, Product Designers, and Engineers) to perform competitive analysis, identify market gaps, size the opportunities and propose new advertising products Facebook should develop

Experience driving action based on data-driven insights
Experience communicating complex concepts to broad audiences
Experience operating independently and delivering results
Experience with SQL and development experience in a scripting language such as R or Python
Understanding of statistical data analysis (e.g. regression, probability)

Experience with experimental design
Experience with digital advertising
Experience working with machine learning algorithms and AI Systems

Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

The Counterparty Risk Analytics team within Citi Quantitative Risk and Stress Testing group is looking to add a VP level Quantitative Analyst/Developer.

Team:

The Counterparty Risk Analytics team is responsible for developing and maintaining the methodologies to calculate counterparty credit risk exposures of OTC derivatives, Exchanged-Traded derivatives and Security Financing Transactions. The models are used for advanced Basel regulatory capital calculations, stress testing, and internal risk management measures.
As a quant developer, you will be developing state of the art codebase used for model implementation, testing and providing analysis for the business. It is a great opportunity to work on some of the most challenging problems of the team and apply new technologies to meet business needs.

Key responsibilities include:

Enhance counterparty credit exposure simulation, pricing, and margin/aggregation models for derivatives products, covering all major asset types
Perform rigorous model testing for all production models, including back-testing, stress testing, and other testing involved in the model development process
Analyze and provide comprehensive explanation of testing results to model reviewers including model validation, risk managers, and senior management
Design, develop, test, release, maintain and improve counterparty credit risk models codebase for calibration, simulation and pricing across all major asset classes
Work closely with model owners to streamline model implementation and testing

Qualifications:

Master’s Degree or equivalent in STEM or other quantitative fields required (Mathematics, Statistics, Financial Engineering, Quantitative Finance etc.) with 3-5 years of Quantitative experience.
Fewer years of relevant experience will be considered for candidates with higher academic qualifications and/or certifications such as a PhD, a second Master’s degree, CPA or CFA
3+ years of professional experience developing quantitative libraries for financial products
Strong object-oriented programming skills in C++ or Python with experience in parallel computing, cloud(Amazon Web Service) a plus
Solid background in mathematics/finance including: stochastic calculus, linear algebra, numerical methods, derivative modeling
Strong work ethic and a team player with excellent time management skills and ability to multi-task
Great communications skills in both verbal and written

Job Description:
*We are still hiring and interviewing for this position. We are conducting interviews over video. We are currently working 100% remote and following the CDC guidelines of when to return to work.**
COMPANY OVERVIEW

Global Atlantic is one of the fastest growing companies in the Life and Annuity industry. We are focused on the U.S. retirement and life insurance markets with a broad range of annuities and life insurance options, as well as reinsurance solutions. Our success is driven by competitive, innovative product designs, leading investment management and integrated risk management, along with highly experienced leadership.

Global Atlantic is looking for a diverse team of talented individuals who reinforce our culture of collaboration and innovation. We are dedicated to the career development of our people because we know they are critical to our long-term success. Join our team and come grow with us.

In July 2020, KKR & Co. signed a strategic transaction to acquire Global Atlantic. The transaction is expected to close in early 2021, subject to required regulatory approvals and certain other customary closing conditions.

POSITION OVERVIEW

The dynamic and growing Risk team has an opening in its New York office as a quantitative developer . The candidate will support the capital market modeling, including the maintenance of scenario generator and the built up of the firm's hedging analytics. An ideal candidate will combine a strong background in quantitative analytics with extensive insurance products knowledge. Typical tasks may include:

Participate in a highly visible project of migrating the firm's hedging process into a python-based Beacon environment
Support further analytical enhancement of the hedging process, including fund regressions for the separate account products etc
Develop/enhance the firm's capital market modeling capability, including equity and rate scenario generator
Management and maintenance of the firm's daily automatic jobs
Achieve automation for key risk reports generation (capital, liquidity, ALM, asset risks etc)
Support the close monitoring of the firm's risk profile and reporting to senior management
Support further developments of the company's risk management by applying analytical methods on other emerging risks (market assumptions, policy holder experience, hedging analysis etc)
Close collaboration both within the Risk team, as well as with other areas such as Actuarial, Finance, and Investments to enhance Global Atlantic Re's financial risk management practices

QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor's Degree required, Advanced Degree preferred in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Science or similar field
Hands-on experience(professional or academic) in programming strongly preferred (Python, R, Matlab, C++, VBA etc)
Minimum of one year of full time work experience or completion of relevant Masters degree is required
Prior capital market (equity/rate/credit) modeling experience highly valuable
Exceptional analytical capabilities and ability to explain complicated technical issues in a clear fashion
Excellent communication skills and ability to work with people of different background.
Ability to work independently and excel in a dynamic, exciting and fast-paced environment

At Global Atlantic, enjoy a highly competitive compensation and benefits package, with a focus on pay equity and flexibility. We are proud to support work/life balance that meet individual and business needs. A business casual dress code, above-average paid time off, parental and military leave, adoption assistance and tuition reimbursement are just a few of the extra perks that make Global Atlantic a great place to work. We strive to foster a culture of total well-being through community outreach and charitable giving programs.

In New York, we actively partner with the Red Hook Conservancy, Girls who Invest, and The Bowery mission. Social platforms provide an environment to collaborate with others and participate in friendly competitions towards achieving physical, emotional and financial well-being. Our highly competitive health, retirement, life and disability plans can be tailored to best suit your needs and those of your whole family.

Global Atlantic is committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can meaningfully contribute to our success. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we do not discriminate in employment on any basis that is prohibited by federal, state or local laws. More than that, we strive to be inclusive of all backgrounds and experiences, which we feel gives us a competitive advantage in the market and within our firm. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status.

Coach is a leading design house of modern luxury accessories and lifestyle collections, with a long-standing reputation built on quality craftsmanship. Defined by a free-spirited, all-American attitude, the brand approaches design with a modern vision, reimagining luxury for today with an authenticity and innovation that is uniquely Coach. All over the world, the Coach name is synonymous with effortless New York style.

Coach is part of the Tapestry portfolio – a global house of brands powered by optimism, innovation, and inclusivity.

Primary Purpose: The Merchandising Strategy team facilitates the development of Coach's long term growth strategy and more immediate operational decisions by providing fact based analysis, consumer insights, and practical recommendations to key decision makers across the Coach organization. Projects in this group focus on how these insights and recommendations can drive decisions for product creation and the go-to-market strategy.

The team conducts detailed analyses of internal data, performs primary consumer research and investigates overall market trends to help the Merchandising team and business partners across all functional areas and geographies develop key insights to better inform product creation and execution of product strategies across the organization.

The successful individual will leverage their proficiency in Strategy to…
Work with Merchandising team, Strategy group, and business partners globally to proactively identify, develop and drive strategies and initiatives that will result in profitable growth for the company.
Drive execution of both strategy and consumer insights projects both as a project manager and strong individual contributor.
Prioritize work streams across multiple projects.
Develop key hypotheses and support/disprove them through data analysis and insights.
Develop strong relationships with business partners at all levels.
Manage projects by working with external market research vendors
Support Senior Management in strategic decision-making
The accomplished individual will possess…
Experience managing projects using both quantitative and qualitative data sources, including ability to provide direction and successfully generate results working with internal or external resources.
Demonstrated strategic and analytic leadership and strong broad business acumen
Possess drive, self-confidence and initiative to work cross-functionally, be a team player, and interface effectively with various departments
Also able to work independently in a fast-paced environment, meet deadlines and manage multiple projects
Exceptional problem solving and analytical skills
Demonstrated ability to generate innovative insights from rigorous analysis.
Strong intellectual curiosity and capacity to constructively question assumptions
Exceptional oral, written and formal presentation skills.
Strong interest in working in retail
An outstanding professional will have…
Minimum of bachelor's degree.
2-4 years work experience, with ideally 2 years in management consulting, investment banking or strategy at a consumer focused company
Significant experience in modeling and creating compelling insights from data
Strong lateral-thinking skills
Demonstrated ability to generate innovative insights from rigorous analysis
Previous experience with or willingness to learn more advanced analytic tools such as Microsoft Access, SAS, or SQL
Global experience, a plus
Our Competencies for All Employees
Drive for Results: Can be counted on to exceed goals successfully; is constantly and consistently one of the top performers; very bottom-line oriented; steadfastly pushes self and others for results.
Customer Focus: Is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers; gets first-hand customer information and uses it for improvements in products and services; acts with customers in mind; establishes and maintains effective relationships with customers and gains their trust and respect.
Creativity: Comes up with a lot of new and unique ideas; easily makes connections among previously unrelated notions; tends to be seen as original and value-added in brainstorming settings.
Interpersonal Savvy: Relates well to all kinds of people, up, down, and sideways, inside and outside the organization; builds appropriate rapport; builds constructive and effective relationships; uses diplomacy and tact; can diffuse even high-tension situations comfortably.
Learning on the Fly: Learns quickly when facing new problems; a relentless and versatile learner; open to change; analyzes both successes and failures for clues to improvement; experiments and will try anything to find solutions; enjoys the challenge of unfamiliar tasks; quickly grasps the essence and the underlying structure of anything.
Perseverance: Pursues everything with energy, drive, and a need to finish; seldom gives up before finishing, especially in the face of resistance or setbacks.
Dealing with Ambiguity: Can effectively cope with change; can shift gears comfortably; can decide and act without having the total picture; isn’t upset when things are up in the air; doesn’t have to finish things before moving on; can comfortably handle risk and uncertainty.
Our Competencies for All People Managers
Strategic Agility: Sees ahead clearly; can anticipate future consequences and trends accurately; has broad knowledge and perspective; is future oriented; can articulately paint credible pictures and visions of possibilities and likelihoods; can create competitive and breakthrough strategies and plans.
Building Effective Teams: Blends people into teams when needed; creates strong morale and spirit in their team; shares wins and successes; fosters open dialogue; lets people finish and be responsible for their work; defines success in terms of the whole team; creates a feeling of belonging in the team.
Managerial Courage: Doesn’t hold back anything that needs to be said; provides current, direct, complete, and “actionable” positive and corrective feedback to others; lets people know where they stand; faces up to people problems on any person or situation (not including direct reports) quickly and directly; is not afraid to take negative action when necessary.

What This Position is All About

This individual is responsible for supporting Media team’s “test-and-learn” initiative within the Marketing organization at Saks and providing best in-class support to brand marketing teams in designing and measuring the impact of precision marketing campaigns. This role will work hand-in-hand with Media & agency teams to oversee performance measurement of marketing strategies across activation partners and tactics. He/she will act as the analytic expert behind Saks’ precision marketing performance measurement aimed at driving statistically significant, actionable insights related to campaigns and pilots.

This person is expected to also be a champion for this analytics and measurement methodology – he/she will be responsible for embedding a test-and-learn mentality throughout the organization, working cross-functionally and at all levels to incorporate best practices into the marketing process, and working with the broader analytics team.

The ideal candidate will have experience with digital marketing and measurement, e.g. web analytics tools like Adobe Analytics, A/B and multivariate testing, media mix models (MMM), multi-touch attribution (MTA), database management, and data analytics, as well as a strong business sense and a willingness to rapidly ramp up on a new way of working. The role is built for a self-starter & creative, quantitative thinker, someone comfortable pushing for structured insights amidst disparate data sets, and someone excited about expanding awareness and sales across HBC’s brands.

Who You Are:
A proactive self-starter with query-based and other database skillsets – beyond strictly digital marketing analytic familiarity; need to be able to draw insights from a broad range of data with the intention of creating actionable insights that can be applied to digital and broader marketing strategies.
Experience working with web analytics packages (e.g. Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics), and with various marketing channels to understand their technical tracking requirements (pixels, URL parameters, etc) a plus
Specifically, needs the following skillsets:
Statistics – Expertise with multivariate statistics, econometrics modeling, and time based regression approaches. Familiarity with supervised and unsupervised machine learning models, including regularization, feature engineering, training, as well as interpretation and integrity
Programming: Proficiency with command-line statistical analysis software (e.g. SAS or R) or with a high-level programming language (e.g. C++, Java, Python, SQL, VB, etc), including familiarity with databases, data wrangling, maintenance, cleaning; knowledge of web analytics packages (e.g. Omniture, Coremetrics or Google Analytics)
Measurement – MMM, MTA, closed loop studies, matched market and pacing variability modeling) and their statistical foundation, but – recognizing the variability and complexity of digital signals – should be comfortable with ’80-20’ output to drive meaningful, actionable business results.
Visualization & Presentation – Represent complex information in easily understood visualization (including Tableau, Excel, etc.). Communicating clearly to executives, technology partners, agencies, and contributing to projects and meetings. Strong Microsoft Excel skills. Ability to code macros in VBA a plus.
Project Management – Strong attention to detail, willingness to wear multiple hats, building and tracking a work plan in a fast-based environment
Calm and comfortable in ever-changing environment; results-driven with an ability to effectively multi-task in a fast-paced environment
Self-driven, curiosity and initiative, building and enriching new, rapidly-growing tools & insights.
Inquisitive thinker, with the ability to form test hypotheses and continuously iterate to drive efficiencies and effectiveness.
You Also Have:

A bachelor’s degree, preferably in Business, Marketing or a quantitative field like Economics, Mathematics or Statistics.
2-3 years in analytics and/or digital marketing with a working understanding of media
Comfort moving between strategic business objectives and consumer-centric engagement tactics and proving those out
As The Marketing Analyst, You Will:
Overall, contribute to Saks’ learning agenda, supporting the translation of learning and measurement goals into testing plans, designing analytically sound set-up parameters, shepherding those parameters through execution, and generating meaningful, actionable interpretations post-pilot or campaign.
Design marketing testing plans to optimize media performance using a multitude of approaches including matched market analyses, time-based regressions, cookie-based split tests, and design of experiments with multivariate analyses
Work with with internal and external stakeholders to refine suggested test & learn agenda, key KPIs, and performance targets to define campaign success and drive learning
Work with internal and external partners to ensure proper campaign and pilot set-up (e.g. matched market analysis process), and audit campaign setup to ensure accuracy
Own and develop measurement architecture for pilots and campaigns; implement through pilot execution
Answer key business questions through statistical analyses, reporting and dashboards using analytics toolset available to the teams (SAS, R, Excel, Adobe Analytics) & Prepare executive-ready presentations summarizing findings and recommendations, and automate reports and dashboards that the organization finds valuable
Coordinate the design and validation of internal and external measurement methodologies, across KPIs for both digital efficiency (related to wasted ad spend) & effectiveness (related to awareness lift, conversion lift & sales contribution) metrics.
Work with internal and external partners to support ongoing optimization against key success KPI and learning agenda, and enforce reporting
Catalog ongoing learnings as they arise to help establish internal benchmarks, playbooks to be leveraged across banners and categories
Own Marketing Channel performance reporting across the organization; partner with marketing channel owners to resolve tracking issues and derive insights, optimizations using SAS, Adobe, Clickstream data etc.
Use clickstream, user behavior, and conversion patterns to identify potential issues in near real time and aid pro-active issue resolution with tech partners
Lead as-needed training to the wider organization on the tools and programs we manage including but not limited to Adobe Analytics, marketing experimentation, MMM & MTA
Assist Media team with any Adobe Analytics questions, dashboarding, annual training, and access
Build/maintain reports tracking marketing measurement using Adobe Analytics or other tools
Other ad-hoc analyses, data projects

Your Life and Career at HBC:

Be part of a world-class team; work with an adventurous spirit; think and act like an owner- operator!
Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities, from retail to supply chain, to digital or corporate.
A culture that promotes a healthy, fulfilling work/life balance.
Benefits package for all eligible full-time employees (including medical, vision and dental).
An amazing employee discount.

Thank you for your interest with HBC. We look forward to reviewing your application.

Kwontified is looking for a skillful marketing professional to join our exciting and fast-paced Marketing Team. Ideal candidates are data-driven creatives with experience leveraging multiple forms of media to deliver engaging consumer experiences and drive sales growth.

The Marketing Analyst will develop skills and work primarily in digital advertising and site merchandising in furtherance of our clients’ e-commerce businesses. He or she will work closely with management and external project managers to draft copy and consumer content, design digital consumer experiences, create and manage digital advertising campaigns, craft ad budgets and phasing schedules, as well as provide performance reporting and analysis.

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business or other closely related major

Strong quantitative and analytical skills

Proficiency in marketing data analysis with Excel

Excellent written and oral communication skills

Proactive team player that welcomes challenges and leadership responsibilities

Experience managing PPC and display ad campaigns to drive brand awareness and sales conversions

Experience drafting copy and content for consumer facing websites, landing pages and/or email campaigns

Preferred Skills

Proficiency in graphic design with Adobe Photoshop and/or Illustrator

Proficiency editing video with Final Cut Pro and/or Adobe Premiere Pro

Proficiency with HTML and CSS

Proficiency with SQL

Experience managing campaigns on the Amazon Advertising, Google AdWords, Facebook Ads, Marketo, and/or Adobe Marketing Cloud platforms.

GENERAL PURPOSE:
The Strategy Analyst will play a key role in helping Ross continue to support its overall strategy, which is to present the customer with attractive bargains on apparel and goods for the home. The Strategy group addresses significant strategic issues for the company that are identified by senior level executives. The Strategy Analyst will report to a Director of Strategy but will work with different project teams and managers. The Strategy Analyst should expect to interact frequently with key functions (Merchandising, Planning, HR, Operations, Finance) and work closely with Strategy team members in both New York and Dublin, CA.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Support key cross-functional initiatives
Coordinate analysis for select cross-functional initiatives (e.g., Merchant process and tool enhancements, business growth projections, roll-out strategy for new business opportunities).
Support implementation of initiatives through development of change management materials, training, and focus groups.
Work closely with Merchants and Planners, but may also touch other areas of the business such as store operations, supply chain, etc.

Perform practical, action oriented, and comprehensive data analysis in support of Strategic business initiatives
Conduct analysis including pulling data, building models and analyzing financial, operational or statistical data to support key strategic priorities for the Company (working in conjunction with Strategy team members and other key senior executives).
Develop compelling materials to communicate results of analysis and key insights internally and externally (e.g., Board meetings, Buyer meetings, Operating Committee meetings, Strategic off-sites)
Analyze business problems and develop insights into root causes and improvement opportunities
Understand the off-price business and diagnose key business problems. Create and execute plans to gather data and develop practical solutions
Monitor ongoing and ad hoc internal and external events
Provide ad hoc business and competitive intelligence and insights for key senior executives: e.g., new store performance, competitive information.

COMPETENCIES:
Communicates Effectively
Ensures Accountability & Execution
Organizational Agility
Manages Conflict
Collaboration
Business Acumen
Leading by Example
Plans, Aligns & Prioritizes

QUALIFICATIONS AND SPECIAL SKILLS REQUIRED:
College degree, preferably with an analytical background
2 years post college experience, preferably in an analytical environment, corporate strategy role, consulting, or financial services firm.
Teamwork: Needs to be able to build effective working relationships within and outside the Strategy team.
Communication: Must be able to listen, understand, and communicate with executives at all levels of the company. Must be able to communicate effectively with Merchants.
Outstanding analytical ability: Must have a data driven approach to solving problems. Requires very strong quantitative skills and a good sense of how to dissect problems.
Must be able to set priorities while conducting analysis to quickly arrive at an actionable solution.
Detail-oriented approach: Must pay close attention to details and have the drive to get things right.
Strong fundamental business skills must be Excel and PowerPoint proficient
Clear understanding of basic financial, statistical and economic concepts

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS/ADA:
Job requires ability to work in an office environment, primarily on a computer.
Requires sitting, standing, walking, hearing, talking on the telephone, attending in-person meetings, typing, and working with paper/files, etc.
Consistent timeliness and regular attendance.
Vision requirements: Ability to see information in print and/or electronically.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:
None

We’re looking for a Senior Insights Analysts to join the Products Analytics team to lead integrating data and insights into our product decisions. Working with Product Managers, you will guide product development with relevant insights based on analysis. You’ll create data sets, design analysis, provide rigorous reporting and make recommendations based on this to help determine our product roadmap. You are focused on impact, and have the skill to understand customers and promote growth. You should demonstrate curiosity, data fluency, and a passion for driving decisions based on data.

You will report to the Manager, Product Analytics in our New York headquarters.

RESPONSIBILITIES
You will work with Product, Engineering, and Design teams to understand project goals, determine measurements, monitor performance, and explore our customers
You'll partner with the Product team to become an expert in a specific product area, understanding requirements and building dashboards that answer common questions; enhance existing dashboards to increase impact, improving user experience and adoption, and measure the health of the business and provide visibility of our data to partners
You'll translate broad questions into plans for research and discovery, perform data exploration, and craft narratives from data insights for non-technical team members that caters to clear storytelling and applicable recommendations
Create all the technical implementations and documentation associated with the dashboards and work toward 100% accuracy
Champion best practice experimentation methodologies and analyze results

1+ years of experience manipulating large datasets using SQL
Love to get deep into the weeds with data and understand edge-cases and how to best represent them
Experience building relationships with teammates, and helping the team to make decisions at a variety of levels
Guide impact by thoughtfully solving open-ended problems

This position plays an integral role in supporting key strategic priorities for Macmillan and Holtzbrinck Group (its parent company) and in turn projects driven by the Group Strategy and M&A team in collaboration with and on behalf of its portfolio of divisions, companies, and ventures primarily in the consumer content and education markets. Reporting to the Senior Vice President of Group Strategy and M&A for Macmillan, this role will be responsible for gathering market intelligence and analysis, supporting the development of the investment/acquisition pipeline and assessment of specific opportunities, providing support for strategic planning processes across the portfolio and preparing of discussion materials and updates for the Macmillan’s board.

Major Responsibilities:

Market Monitoring: Track, analyze, synthesize and report on general marketplace trends, competitive developments, emerging companies, new opportunities and threats to Macmillan’s businesses (via news sources, secondary research, team gathered intel, data analysis, conference attendance, etc.).
M&A Support: Help identify and screen potential investment/acquisition opportunities; Help conduct analysis and diligence on specific investment/acquisition opportunities (i.e. new markets companies, products, business models) and support completion of transactions and integration of the assets into the portfolio.
Strategic Support: Provide support for corporate, division, unit level strategic/business planning.
Business Development: Support evaluation and implementation of strategic partnerships; and exploration and experimentation with innovative new business models and growth initiatives.

Skills/Knowledge You'll Bring:

Strong analytical acumen
Solid interpersonal, oral and written communication skills
Entrepreneurial spirit
Must be highly organized and work quickly
Easily handle and adapt to numerous and shifting priorities
Must be a power user in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint applications and comfortable utilizing databases (or large unstructured datasets)
Strong qualitative and quantitative research skills
Must be able to work through vast amounts of information/data; and construe patterns to surface business insights
Must be adept at synthesis and visualization of information/data (whether presentations, models, etc.)
Must be highly collaborative and a team player
Must have client centric orientation (with high comfort collaborating with and/or presenting to external/internal clients)
Experience in publishing, education technology, digital media is a plus

Experience & Education Needed:

Minimum of 3 years experience as an analyst in a management consultancy, investment bank or corporate development department for large company preferred
Must have a strong quantitative background (ideally actual experience constructing financial/business/market models) and able to quickly analyze large amounts of quantitative and qualitative data, and clearly summarize & present findings from data analyses to an executive management audience
Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Business Administration or other related field or equivalent work experience.

Macmillan Publishers is a global trade book publishing company with prominent imprints around the world, publishing a broad range of award-winning books for children and adults in all categories and formats. Macmillan Publishers is committed to our authors, our employees, and to the environment.

U.S. publishers include Celadon Books, Farrar, Straus and Giroux, Flatiron Books, Henry Holt & Company, Macmillan Audio, Macmillan Children’s Publishing Group, Picador, St. Martin's Press and Tor Books. In the UK, Australia, India, and South Africa, Macmillan publishes under the Pan Macmillan name. The German company, Holtzbrinck Deutsche Buchverlage, includes among its imprints S. Fischer, Kiepenheuer and Witsch, Rowohlt, and Droemer Knaur.

Macmillan Publishers is a division of the Holtzbrinck Publishing Group, a large family-owned media company headquartered in Stuttgart, Germany.

Job Description:

Description

The candidate will work alongside their Senior Analyst and Junior Analyst peers in all aspects to produce and market quantitative research to BofA financial advisors, BofA sales and trading, as well as to institutional accounts, such as hedge funds and long only asset managers. The candidate will work on idea generation to present relevant quantitative research themes and views, including investor positioning, flows, equity factor models and index rebalances. The candidate will also analyze new investment strategies by backtesting new (alternative) data sets, such as the Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) attributes and Natural Language Processing (NLP) data products.

Responsibilities
Write regular equity quantitative research reports
Produce collaborative reports with fundamental analysts and across asset classes
Develop and maintain databases and indicators integral to our research product
Closely monitor and interpret factor rotation and relay to Senior Analyst
Generate investment ideas by backtesting BofA’s proprietary data sets as well as third party data
Work closely with the ESG research team and analyze implications of ESG attributes in investment processes
Build relationships and facilitate information flow with contacts across the BofA platform.
Participate and contribute to client meetings and events
Attend meetings and interact with key opinion leaders
Seek out new, value-added, and/or off-the-beaten-path sources of information
Leverage our robust network of industry contacts & interact regularly with clients
Qualifications
BA in Finance or a related quantitative field, Computer Science, Engineering, or Physics
5 to 10 years of related work experience preferred
Experience back-testing investment strategies, working with alternative data sets a plus
Experience in ESG/sustainable investing or related field a plus
Strong writing and spreadsheet skills; must have advanced MS Excel skills
Experience working with statistical packages and/or programming experience (e.g. Python and SQL) preferred
Experience utilizing FactSet (Alpha testing and Universal Screening) and MS Access preferred
Entrepreneurial, proactive, willing to take ownership of quantitative research products
Able to thrive in a fast-paced and intense environment
Must have excellent attention to detail, ability to multi-task
Must have strong communication skills, written and verbal
Must work well in a collaborative team environment
Shift:

1st shift (United States of America)

Hours Per Week:

40

Job Title: Global Research, Director/Vice President, Quantitative Research Strategist

Job Description:
Coach is a leading design house of modern luxury accessories and lifestyle collections, with a long-standing reputation built on quality craftsmanship. Defined by a free-spirited, all-American attitude, the brand approaches design with a modern vision, reimagining luxury for today with an authenticity and innovation that is uniquely Coach. All over the world, the Coach name is synonymous with effortless New York style.

Coach is part of the Tapestry portfolio – a global house of brands powered by optimism, innovation, and inclusivity.

Primary Purpose: The Merchandising Strategy team facilitates the development of Coach's long term growth strategy and more immediate operational decisions by providing fact based analysis, consumer insights, and practical recommendations to key decision makers across the Coach organization. Projects in this group focus on how these insights and recommendations can drive decisions for product creation and the go-to-market strategy.

The team conducts detailed analyses of internal data, performs primary consumer research and investigates overall market trends to help the Merchandising team and business partners across all functional areas and geographies develop key insights to better inform product creation and execution of product strategies across the organization.

The successful individual will leverage their proficiency in Strategy to…
Work with Merchandising team, Strategy group, and business partners globally to proactively identify, develop and drive strategies and initiatives that will result in profitable growth for the company.
Drive execution of both strategy and consumer insights projects both as a project manager and strong individual contributor.
Prioritize work streams across multiple projects.
Develop key hypotheses and support/disprove them through data analysis and insights.
Develop strong relationships with business partners at all levels.
Manage projects by working with external market research vendors
Support Senior Management in strategic decision-making
The accomplished individual will possess…
Experience managing projects using both quantitative and qualitative data sources, including ability to provide direction and successfully generate results working with internal or external resources.
Demonstrated strategic and analytic leadership and strong broad business acumen
Possess drive, self-confidence and initiative to work cross-functionally, be a team player, and interface effectively with various departments
Also able to work independently in a fast-paced environment, meet deadlines and manage multiple projects
Exceptional problem solving and analytical skills
Demonstrated ability to generate innovative insights from rigorous analysis.
Strong intellectual curiosity and capacity to constructively question assumptions
Exceptional oral, written and formal presentation skills.
Strong interest in working in retail
An outstanding professional will have…
Minimum of bachelor's degree.
2-4 years work experience, with ideally 2 years in management consulting, investment banking or strategy at a consumer focused company
Significant experience in modeling and creating compelling insights from data
Strong lateral-thinking skills
Demonstrated ability to generate innovative insights from rigorous analysis
Previous experience with or willingness to learn more advanced analytic tools such as Microsoft Access, SAS, or SQL
Global experience, a plus
Our Competencies for All Employees
Drive for Results: Can be counted on to exceed goals successfully; is constantly and consistently one of the top performers; very bottom-line oriented; steadfastly pushes self and others for results.
Customer Focus: Is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers; gets first-hand customer information and uses it for improvements in products and services; acts with customers in mind; establishes and maintains effective relationships with customers and gains their trust and respect.
Creativity: Comes up with a lot of new and unique ideas; easily makes connections among previously unrelated notions; tends to be seen as original and value-added in brainstorming settings.
Interpersonal Savvy: Relates well to all kinds of people, up, down, and sideways, inside and outside the organization; builds appropriate rapport; builds constructive and effective relationships; uses diplomacy and tact; can diffuse even high-tension situations comfortably.
Learning on the Fly: Learns quickly when facing new problems; a relentless and versatile learner; open to change; analyzes both successes and failures for clues to improvement; experiments and will try anything to find solutions; enjoys the challenge of unfamiliar tasks; quickly grasps the essence and the underlying structure of anything.
Perseverance: Pursues everything with energy, drive, and a need to finish; seldom gives up before finishing, especially in the face of resistance or setbacks.
Dealing with Ambiguity: Can effectively cope with change; can shift gears comfortably; can decide and act without having the total picture; isn’t upset when things are up in the air; doesn’t have to finish things before moving on; can comfortably handle risk and uncertainty.
Our Competencies for All People Managers
Strategic Agility: Sees ahead clearly; can anticipate future consequences and trends accurately; has broad knowledge and perspective; is future oriented; can articulately paint credible pictures and visions of possibilities and likelihoods; can create competitive and breakthrough strategies and plans.
Building Effective Teams: Blends people into teams when needed; creates strong morale and spirit in their team; shares wins and successes; fosters open dialogue; lets people finish and be responsible for their work; defines success in terms of the whole team; creates a feeling of belonging in the team.
Managerial Courage: Doesn’t hold back anything that needs to be said; provides current, direct, complete, and “actionable” positive and corrective feedback to others; lets people know where they stand; faces up to people problems on any person or situation (not including direct reports) quickly and directly; is not afraid to take negative action when necessary.

The Counterparty Risk Analytics team within Citi Quantitative Risk and Stress Testing group is looking to add a VP level Quantitative Analyst/Developer.

Team:

The Counterparty Risk Analytics team is responsible for developing and maintaining the methodologies to calculate counterparty credit risk exposures of OTC derivatives, Exchanged-Traded derivatives and Security Financing Transactions. The models are used for advanced Basel regulatory capital calculations, stress testing, and internal risk management measures.
As a quant developer, you will be developing state of the art codebase used for model implementation, testing and providing analysis for the business. It is a great opportunity to work on some of the most challenging problems of the team and apply new technologies to meet business needs.

Key responsibilities include:

Enhance counterparty credit exposure simulation, pricing, and margin/aggregation models for derivatives products, covering all major asset types
Perform rigorous model testing for all production models, including back-testing, stress testing, and other testing involved in the model development process
Analyze and provide comprehensive explanation of testing results to model reviewers including model validation, risk managers, and senior management
Design, develop, test, release, maintain and improve counterparty credit risk models codebase for calibration, simulation and pricing across all major asset classes
Work closely with model owners to streamline model implementation and testing

Qualifications:

Master’s Degree or equivalent in STEM or other quantitative fields required (Mathematics, Statistics, Financial Engineering, Quantitative Finance etc.) with 3-5 years of Quantitative experience.
Fewer years of relevant experience will be considered for candidates with higher academic qualifications and/or certifications such as a PhD, a second Master’s degree, CPA or CFA
3+ years of professional experience developing quantitative libraries for financial products
Strong object-oriented programming skills in C++ or Python with experience in parallel computing, cloud(Amazon Web Service) a plus
Solid background in mathematics/finance including: stochastic calculus, linear algebra, numerical methods, derivative modeling
Strong work ethic and a team player with excellent time management skills and ability to multi-task
Great communications skills in both verbal and written

Job Description:
As one of the world’s leading asset managers, we are solely dedicated to delivering an investment experience that helps people get more out of life. If you're looking for challenging work, smart colleagues, and a global employer with a social conscience, explore your potential at Invesco

The Department

This role resides in our Financial Planning & Analysis department within our Finance & Corporate Strategy (FCS) division. It is aligned to provide FP&A support to the Global Marketing, Corporate Communications and Human Resources business lines.

Your Role

This position is responsible for corporate financial planning, forecasting, reporting, analysis and decision support. The FP&A Analyst establishes and maintains relationships with key business partners and stakeholders within the greater Finance and Corporate Strategy (FCS) division.

You will be responsible for:
Coordinate and develop the annual, quarterly, and monthly forecast for assigned departments, including updating the department’s forecast as necessary, as well as identifying variances and recommending corrective action.
Serve as liaison between the business partners and FCS.
Conduct financial and strategic analysis to support significant business decisions (e.g. new product initiatives, cost benefit analysis, outsourcing). Make recommendations regarding alternative courses of action.
Analyze expense and revenue drivers. Develop models to forecast profitability and determine sensitivity analysis regarding multiple variable changes such as market appreciation/depreciation, fee structures, and sales projections.
Issue monthly, quarterly, and ad hoc reports used by business partner management, such as financials, strategic initiative progress, metric reporting, sales/assets trends, revenue yields, etc.
Monitor, track and analyze key performance indicators and communicate relevant trends.
Challenge and restructure existing processes to achieve synergies and efficiencies across the organization.
Use data analytics/business intelligence tools to provide cost transparency to business partners and Finance leadership

The experience you bring:
1-3 years of Finance experience with a concentration in financial planning, management reporting, quantitative analysis, scenario planning, and decision modeling.
High level proficiency in Microsoft Office with a focus on Access, PowerPoint & Excel (i.e Pivot Tables, Formulas, VLOOKUP functions, Macros, Index Match, etc.).
Strong communication skills including verbal, written, and presentation.
Knowledge of Oracle and/or Hyperion planning is a plus.
Prior experience in investment management or financial services is an asset.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills as a data driven critical thinker and problem solver.
Comfort applying the latest financial management technologies and using automated tools as appropriate (E.g. experience with data visualization tools such as Microsoft Power BI or Tableau is a plus).
Agile and organized with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced dynamic environment and demonstrate a methodical approach to assignments.

What’s in it for you?

Our people are at the very core of our success. Invesco employees get more out of life through our comprehensive compensation and benefit offerings including:

Flexible time off and opportunities for a flexible work schedule
401(K) matching of 100% up to the first 6% with additional supplemental contribution
Health & wellbeing benefits
Parental Leave benefits
Employee stock purchase plan

COMPANY OVERVIEW

Global Atlantic is one of the fastest growing companies in the Life and Annuity industry. We are focused on the U.S. retirement and life insurance markets with a broad range of annuities and life insurance options, as well as reinsurance solutions. Our success is driven by competitive, innovative product designs, leading investment management and integrated risk management, along with highly experienced leadership.

Global Atlantic is looking for a diverse team of talented individuals who reinforce our culture of collaboration and innovation. We are dedicated to the career development of our people because we know they are critical to our long-term success. Join our team and come grow with us.

In July 2020, KKR & Co. signed a strategic transaction to acquire Global Atlantic. The transaction is expected to close in early 2021, subject to required regulatory approvals and certain other customary closing conditions.

POSITION OVERVIEW

The dynamic and growing Risk team has an opening in its New York office as a quantitative developer . The candidate will support the capital market modeling, including the maintenance of scenario generator and the built up of the firm's hedging analytics. An ideal candidate will combine a strong background in quantitative analytics with extensive insurance products knowledge. Typical tasks may include:

Participate in a highly visible project of migrating the firm's hedging process into a python-based Beacon environment
Support further analytical enhancement of the hedging process, including fund regressions for the separate account products etc
Develop/enhance the firm's capital market modeling capability, including equity and rate scenario generator
Management and maintenance of the firm's daily automatic jobs
Achieve automation for key risk reports generation (capital, liquidity, ALM, asset risks etc)
Support the close monitoring of the firm's risk profile and reporting to senior management
Support further developments of the company's risk management by applying analytical methods on other emerging risks (market assumptions, policy holder experience, hedging analysis etc)
Close collaboration both within the Risk team, as well as with other areas such as Actuarial, Finance, and Investments to enhance Global Atlantic Re's financial risk management practices

QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor's Degree required, Advanced Degree preferred in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Science or similar field
Hands-on experience(professional or academic) in programming strongly preferred (Python, R, Matlab, C++, VBA etc)
Minimum of one year of full time work experience or completion of relevant Masters degree is required
Prior capital market (equity/rate/credit) modeling experience highly valuable
Exceptional analytical capabilities and ability to explain complicated technical issues in a clear fashion
Excellent communication skills and ability to work with people of different background.
Ability to work independently and excel in a dynamic, exciting and fast-paced environment

At Global Atlantic, enjoy a highly competitive compensation and benefits package, with a focus on pay equity and flexibility. We are proud to support work/life balance that meet individual and business needs. A business casual dress code, above-average paid time off, parental and military leave, adoption assistance and tuition reimbursement are just a few of the extra perks that make Global Atlantic a great place to work. We strive to foster a culture of total well-being through community outreach and charitable giving programs.

In New York, we actively partner with the Red Hook Conservancy, Girls who Invest, and The Bowery mission. Social platforms provide an environment to collaborate with others and participate in friendly competitions towards achieving physical, emotional and financial well-being. Our highly competitive health, retirement, life and disability plans can be tailored to best suit your needs and those of your whole family.

Be a
part of the transformation at MVP Health Care®. MVP Health Care is a
nationally-recognized, regional not-for-profit health insurer. We care for
more than 700,000 members across New York and Vermont and are powered by the
ideas and energy of more than 1,700 employees. We employ talented
people with diverse backgrounds and experience—tech people, numbers
people, even people people—to
make health insurance more convenient, more supportive, and more personal. If
you’re ready to join a thriving, mission-driven company where you can create
your own opportunities—it’s time to make a healthy career move to MVP.

General Overview:

The Lead Quantitative Analyst will design and develop reports and analyze data to measure clinical and financial outcomes. This role will investigate key business problems through quantitative analyses of utilization and health care costs data. Specifically, the Lead Quantitative Analyst will work closely with clinical and business leaders to drive trending and operational analytics for population identification, program need, and emerging risk. The successful candidate will employ subject matter expertise to provide insights to relevant stakeholders using advanced statistical methods to measure and evaluate current and future health plan initiatives. Additionally, this role will conduct statistical analyses to measure and address financial and quality improvements and outcomes, perform modeling and analysis of health care costs, utilization, and outcomes; and collaborate with other departments to advance business objectives and research studies.

Essential Job Functions:
Leverage advanced analytical knowledge to drive the development of analytical solutions and implement data-driven recommendations and outcomes.
Work closely with customers in determining analytic needs and present and interpret outcomes of statistical analyses to customers.
Develop analytics plans including determining types of data needed, optimal study design, and appropriate statistical analyses.
Work with complex healthcare claims and clinical data, recognize patterns and potential issues within the data and make recommendations based upon the analysis of the data.
Develop sophisticated data products (visualizations, models, insights, etc.) for business users.
Perform statistical analyses to determine effectiveness of clinical programs.
Provide consultative advice and interpret and summarize analytical findings.
Leverage existing and ad-hoc reporting capabilities to identify trends in health plan performance and opportunities for medical expense reduction and improvement in the quality and cost of care.
Perform data extraction, aggregation, and quality checking from multiple sources and tables in the support of trend identification, root cause analysis, program evaluation, population identification, quality improvement, and validation/measurement of medical expense reduction initiatives.
Required Qualifications:
Master’s Degree with 3 years of work experience or Bachelor’s Degree with 5 years work experience in Biostatistics, Public Health, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Quantitative Social Sciences, Statistics, or Data Sciences.
Minimum of 3 years SAS, R, Python, or other relevant statistical programming experience.
Minimum of 3 years SQL programming language experience.
Minimum of 3 years experience in health care data analytics including experience with claims data, pharmaceutical data, EHR data, clinical research, etc.Experience with Health Plan quality metrics (HEDIS, QARR, PDI, PQI, CMS Stars, etc.), episode groupers, and risk adjustment methodologies highly preferred.
Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word and proficient in other MS Office tools such as PowerPoint and Power BI.
Ability to work independently, as well as work effectively as a member of a team.
Highly skilled in verbal and written communication.
Ability to prioritize multiple assignments with attention to details and deadlines in a high volume environment.
Proven ability to build relationships with business and technical partners to improve customer service and continuously improve project delivery.
Must be self-motivated, proactive, and able to work well under pressure.

Job Title: Data & Analysis Admin, Professional, Lead Quantitative Analyst

Job Description:
GTS is a leading global electronic market maker, powered by combining market expertise with innovative, proprietary technology. As a quantitative trading firm continually building for the future, GTS leverages the latest in artificial intelligence systems and sophisticated pricing models to bring consistency, efficiency, and transparency to today’s financial markets. GTS accounts for 3-5% of daily cash equities volume in the U.S. and trades over 30,000 different instruments globally, including listed and OTC equities, ETFs, futures, commodities, Fixed Income, foreign exchange, and interest rate products. GTS is the largest Designated Market Maker (DMM) at the New York Stock Exchange, responsible for nearly $12 trillion of market capitalization. Our workplace of 200 plus employees welcomes people of all backgrounds and experiences, and we take pride in our diverse workforce. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, gender or gender identification, sexual orientation, disability, protected veteran status and statuses protected by law. The GTS culture is collaborative and entrepreneurial and welcomes individuals of all kinds.

GTS is expanding its trading of global ETF Products and looking for quant strategists with proven alpha to join our team. The primary focus of the trading strategies should be ETFs, but all products are available for trading including equities, futures, fixed income, and FX.
Designing, managing, and running your trading strategies in collaboration with our existing team
Perform your own trading strategy design and research which requires high level development on C++ and Python
Collaborate with the team’s technology and trading experts for production implementation
Work with existing team while contributing own alphas and strategies
Strategy Style:
The trading strategies can be either price making or taking and can be either purely prop or market making in style. Expectation are for higher Sharpe / lower drawdown strategies that perform well on a consistent basis under many market conditions. Based on our low-cost infrastructure strategies that meet the performance criteria with lower absolute PnL can be attractive to both GTS and the candidate’s compensation.

Strategy requirements: Min. 1-year track record in production, 3+ Sharpe ratio, no minimum P&L required
Strong programming skills, C++ and Python preferred
3 years in a trading or quantitative research position
Significant experience with alpha generation and portfolio management
Educational background in engineering, math, statistics, finance, or financial engineering
Self-motivated, hard-working, and creative personality
Clear and confident communication skills
Visa sponsorship available for the right candidate.
We are proud to employ some of the leading talent in the industry, and we work to ensure our employees enjoy a high quality-of-life.
What We Offer:
A selection of healthcare plans for you and your family, some 100% employer paid: with coverage starting on day one
Free lunch daily and a fully stocked pantry
Casual dress code
Company outings, including bowling, casino nights and happy hours

About Cubist
Cubist Systematic Strategies is one of the world’s premier investment firms. The firm deploys systematic, computer-driven trading strategies across multiple liquid asset classes, including equities, futures and foreign exchange. The core of our effort is rigorous research into a wide range of market anomalies, fueled by our unparalleled access to a wide range of publicly available data sources.
Job Description
This is an opportunity for students and researchers of advanced data modeling and statistical learning methods to apply these techniques to market prediction and systematic trading.
Job Responsibilities
Reseach interesting trading ideas from academic papers, blogs, and other sources
Pre-process (validate, clean, normalize, reduce dimension) very large data sets for model estimation and event studies
Identify features and relationships useful for the predictive modeling of market dynamics
Design and implement systematic strategies that can exploit market abnormalities
Desirable Candidates
Undergraduate, MS, or PhD candidates in finance, computer science, mathematics, physics, or other quantitative discipline
Programming in any of the following: C++, Java, C#, MATLAB, R, Python, or Perl
Strong analytical and quantitative skills
Demonstrated interest in financial markets and systematic trading
Clear, concise, and proactive communicator
Detail-oriented
Willing to take ownership of his/her work, working both independently and within a small team
We’re looking for exceptional colleagues with unparalleled passion. If you’d like your resume to stand out, tell us about your exceptional personal achievements, even if they have nothing to do with finance. Of course we love to hear more about specific engineering or data projects that you’ve worked outside of school, or as part of your curriculum. If you’re proud of the work you did we want to hear about it. In addition to exceptional statisticians and engineers, we work with talented musicians, writers, mathematicians, and founders of non-profits; we’d love to learn more about what excites you.

Company Description:

Quartet is a pioneering healthcare technology company striving to improve the lives of people with mental health conditions. We connect people to a personalized care team to get them the right care at the right time. Our collaborative technology platform and range of services brings together physicians, mental health providers, and insurance companies to effectively improve patient outcomes and drive down healthcare costs. Backed by $153MM in venture funding from top investors like Oak HC/FT, GV (formerly Google Ventures), F-Prime Capital Partners, Polaris Partners, Centene Corporation and Echo Ventures. Quartet is headquartered in NYC and is currently operating in several markets across the United States Pennsylvania, Washington, Northern California, New Jersey, North Carolina, Louisiana, and Illinois.

About the team & opportunity:

As a Data Scientist at Quartet, you will work on a range of projects -- developing statistical analyses to study impact of Quartet interventions; predicting mental health needs among populations; building machine learning models to suggest timely and appropriate behavioral health care interventions for patients. You'll develop a deep understanding of Quartet interventions and the predictive models and algorithms.

You will design and develop effective models, features, and algorithms involving multiple datasets, including user activity, Electronic Health Records (EHR), admissions, discharges and transfers (ADT), medical claims, pharmacy claims, and lab test claims. Leverages knowledge of computer science, machine learning, data mining and software architecture to build high-quality data products. Supports the design of Quartet products, including: an entity resolution and de-duplication library for linking patients and providers data, which is collected from multiple sources; a machine learning application for the detection of opioid use disorder in patients using supervised learning and deep learning; and an optical mark recognition (OMR) computer vision application for transcribing paper assessments.

Accountabilities:
Research and develop machine-learning and statistical models in Quartet Health's platform to improve software personalization and recommendations for users
Drives a data-informed process for experimenting with new products to improve patient outcomes and operational efficiency.
Performing ML research, exploratory data analysis, and computer-vision modeling; developing model evaluation and online maintenance methodologies, including confidence estimation, calibration, and concept drift
Develop general-purpose frameworks to support machine learning applications in production.
Minimum Qualifications:
2-3 years experience as a data scientist.
Formal training in statistics and computer science.
Knowledge of mathematical fundamentals: probability theory, linear algebra and statistics.
Strong data transformation and extraction skills with SQL databases.
Strong statistical programming skills in both Python and R.
Comfort/self-sufficiency with Amazon Web Services infrastructure.
Comfort/self-sufficiency with Linux command line.
Comfort/self-sufficiency with git for version control.
Ability to work on projects from initial to final phase- beginning by defining a problem, developing an implementation plan, and overseeing deployment and maintenance.
Ability to clearly communicate across disciplines and work collaboratively.
Experience with any of the following: Docker, TensorFlow, Keras, Numpy, Scipy, Pandas, Gensim, Scikit-learn, NLKT, Jupyter
Employee Benefits for Quartet include: Unlimited vacation, volunteer opportunities, team events, mental healthcare coverage of 15 free therapy sessions + unlimited copay reimbursements, medical, dental + vision coverage, generous parental and military leave, commuter benefits, 401K, and stock option grants.

Description of the role

J.P. Morgan's Global Index Research Group is the central hub for fixed income security analytics and fixed income indices within the Corporate and Investment bank, and is part of the Global Research organization. The group is a leading provider of indices across fixed income with a market leading presence in Emerging Market (EM) and Developed Market (DM) Indices, accounting for over 95% of the market with over $700 billion in assets tracking the various EM index products.

The Index Group is responsible for creating, managing and marketing J.P. Morgan proprietary indices and commercialization of research fixed income data. We are looking for a quantitative project lead that will work with the index and fixed income analysts within the Index Research desk to track and a support the delivery of some of our products and system initiatives. This front-office role involves a firm understanding of market data and data technologies and as well as an outstanding project management ability in a technical setting. The candidate will serve as a liaison between our product experts, technology teams, and operations organization to deliver our franchise's data products and improve our processes. In this seat you will be responsible for coordinating operations and delivery across a global multi-organizational environment. Attention to detail and organizational skills are critical.

Responsibilities of the candidate:

In this role, you will support the life cycle of index and fixed income analytics products. Your duties will include:

• Project oversight of complex index build efforts that span multiple teams and geographies. Create and execute strategic product roadmaps. Coordinate status updates and level set with stakeholders and senior product owners.

• Drive the design, implementation and launch of index and analytics products, across the full development lifecycle and in partnership with stakeholders across the business. This includes leading the efforts on planning and testing new features and calculations, data feeds, coordinating UAT phases, and maintaining supporting documentation for production releases

• Support of system enhancement efforts as well as operational improvements to our current workflows. This entails detailed analysis and documentation and writing business requirement documents for the technology teams.

• Participate in the prioritization effort to queue new development and features for the index and fixed income analytics build

• Act as a content manager for data that is exposed to clients and become knowledgeable of the index and fixed income analytics offering for internal and external teams

• Maintain engagement with our client teams and analytics clients on questions and enhancements to the data offering and channels (including realtime feeds, data feeds, and analytics calculators). Act as a liaison to the commercialization team to ensure our offering and strategy aligns

• Coordinate with firm-wide strategic programs that are relevant to the index and security analytics efforts, maintaining relationships and identifying synergies for our products and large scale efforts

• Be able to maintain a high level view of the organization's efforts with the ability to deep dive and support the work hands on

Qualifications

ü Minimum education and requirements: Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Financial Engineering, Operations Research, Economics/Finance, or related field. Masters degree a plus.

ü Proven track record of leadership or experience on quantitative implementation endeavors

ü Technology or quantitative related work experience in financial services

ü Experience with SQL and databases and data manipulation techniques

ü Familiarity with market data and products. Knowledge or experience in fixed income a plus

ü Superb organizational skills, decisive priority management, strong teamwork ethic, ability to think locally& execute globally

ü Strong communication skills (both written and verbal)

The ideal candidate for this role would be individuals with impeccable organizational and communication skills that have a track record in the areas of engineering, technical product delivery, and team management. Candidates should have at least 3-5 years of experience in the technical product delivery or technology in the financial domain and have a keen interest in the financial markets and businessJPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.
